creator: alistair.forbes@2e-systems.com
text:
If I abnormally shutdown my server, the ExternalRolledFileAppender is sometimes
left listening on the port. (seen with netstat -na) When restarting the server,
I get an endless loop with the exception listed below. My guess is that the
appender should throw the exception higher and not catch and retry the same
thing. I'll try to look at the source code later in the week.

java.net.BindException: Address already in use
	at java.net.PlainSocketImpl.socketBind(Native Method)
	at java.net.PlainSocketImpl.bind(PlainSocketImpl.java:414)
	at java.net.ServerSocket.<init>(ServerSocket.java:182)
	at java.net.ServerSocket.<init>(ServerSocket.java:94)
	at org.apache.log4j.varia.HUP.run(ExternallyRolledFileAppender.java:127)

creator: carnold@apache.org
text:
I believe this issue would be fixed by v 1.17 of ExternallyRolledFileAppender in the log4j 1.3 line.  Please 
reopen if it is observed in that branch.
